title: 5 Simple Ways to Align Your HP Printer

steps.title: Power on your HP printer.
steps.content: Power on your HP printer. This method teaches you how to use the free HP Smart printer management app for any device including Android, iPhone, iPad, Mac, and Windows. You also have the option of using the HP Solutions Center (2010 models and later) or HP Printer Assistant (models older than 2010) to manage your printer. If you already have one of these apps in your Start menu (Windows), you can use the Using HP Solutions Center or Printer Assistant for Windows method as an alternative.

steps.title: Load a small stack of plain white paper into the printer’s input tray.
steps.content: Load a small stack of plain white paper into the printer’s input tray. The paper you use to align the printer must be blank, white, and the standard letter-size (8.5" x 11").

steps.title: Open the HP Smart app on your phone or computer.
steps.content: Open the HP Smart app on your phone or computer. Click or tap the app icon that looks a printer and phone. If you don't have it, you can get the app for free from the App Store on your iPhone or iPad , Google Play Store on your Android , Microsoft Store on Windows 10-11 , or App Store on your Mac .

steps.title: Click your printer in the HP Smart window.
steps.content: Click your printer in the HP Smart window. If you don't see your printer, for example if this is the first time you're using the app, you'll have to follow the on-screen instructions to set it up.

steps.title: Click Print Quality Tools.
steps.content: Click Print Quality Tools . It's in the left column under the "Utility" header. If you don't see text options in the left column, click the three-line menu at the top-left corner of the window to expand them.

steps.title: Click the Align option.
steps.content: Click the Align option.

steps.title: Follow the on-screen instructions.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen instructions. The Align option will walk you through the process of printing a special page that realigns your printer cartridges. If your printer has a built-in scanner, this process will involve scanning the alignment page. Further instructions will appear on the screen. If you see get an error that says "Alignment Failed" or "Alignment Unsuccessful," see the Fixing Alignment Issues method.

steps.title: Power on your HP printer.
steps.content: Power on your HP printer. This method should work for all versions of Windows. If your HP printer was released in 2010 or after, you likely have the HP Solutions Center on your computer. If it's older, you'll probably have the HP Printer Assistant software instead. To find out which HP software is installed, open the Start menu, locate the HP sub-menu, and look for HP Solutions Center or HP Printer Assistant . If you don't have either option, go to https://support.hp.com/us-en/drivers in a web browser and follow the on-screen instructions to find and download the HP Easy Start install app for your printer model.

steps.title: Load a small stack of plain white paper into the printer’s input tray.
steps.content: Load a small stack of plain white paper into the printer’s input tray. The paper you use to align the printer must be blank, white, and the standard letter-size (8.5" x 11").

steps.title: Open the HP Solution Center application on your computer.
steps.content: Open the HP Solution Center application on your computer. You should find it in your Start menu, sometimes in a folder called HP . If you don't see HP Solutions Center , open HP Printer Assistant . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's near the bottom of the window. If you're using HP Printer Assistant, click Print and Scan and then Maintain Your Printer . Then, skip to Step 7.

steps.title: Click Print Settings.
steps.content: Click Print Settings .

steps.title: Click Printer Services or Device Services.
steps.content: Click Printer Services or Device Services .

steps.title: Click Printer Toolbox.
steps.content: Click Printer Toolbox .

steps.title: Check the box next to "Align the Print Cartridges."
steps.content: Check the box next to "Align the Print Cartridges." It's under the "Print Quality" header at the center of the window.

steps.title: Click Align.
steps.content: Click Align . It's at the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Follow the on-screen instructions to align the printer cartridges.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen instructions to align the printer cartridges. If your printer has a built-in scanner, this process will involve scanning the alignment page. Further instructions will appear on the screen. If you see get an error that says "Alignment Failed" or "Alignment Unsuccessful," see the Fixing Alignment Issues method.

steps.title: Power on your HP printer.
steps.content: Power on your HP printer.

steps.title: Load a small stack of plain white paper into the printer’s input tray.
steps.content: Load a small stack of plain white paper into the printer’s input tray. The paper you use to align the printer must be blank, white, and the standard letter-size (8.5" x 11").

steps.title: Open HP Utility on your Mac.
steps.content: Open HP Utility on your Mac. If it's installed, you'll find it in the Applications folder in a sub-folder called HP . If you don't see the app, you'll need to install it. Go to https://support.hp.com/us-en/drivers in a web browser and follow the on-screen instructions to find and download the HP Easy Start install app for your printer model. Once downloaded, double-click the .dmg file to install HP Utility.

steps.title: Click Align.
steps.content: Click Align . It's in the first group of icons. This opens the Align Cartridges window.

steps.title: Click Align.
steps.content: Click Align . This sends an alignment page to your printer. The printed page will display many numbered boxes with black and blue lines.

steps.title: Find the box in row A with the lines that overlap the most.
steps.content: Find the box in row A with the lines that overlap the most. The box that shows the largest gap between lines is the one you're looking for. [2] X Research source Note the number of the box.

steps.title: Select the corresponding box number in your printer software.
steps.content: Select the corresponding box number in your printer software. Choose the right box from column A.

steps.title: Select the boxes with the lines that overlap most in the other columns.
steps.content: Select the boxes with the lines that overlap most in the other columns. Continue until you've made a selection for all column letters.

steps.title: Click Done.
steps.content: Click Done . The printer cartridges will now realign. If you see get an error that says "Alignment Failed" or "Alignment Unsuccessful," see the Fixing Alignment Issues method.

steps.title: Power on your HP printer.
steps.content: Power on your HP printer. If your printer has a display on the unit, you can align the print cartridges without using a computer.

steps.title: Load a small stack of plain white paper into the printer’s input tray.
steps.content: Load a small stack of plain white paper into the printer’s input tray.

steps.title: Navigate to your printer's Settings or Tools menu.
steps.content: Navigate to your printer's Settings or Tools menu. You can use the arrow keys next to the printer's display to navigate. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Select Align Printer.
steps.content: Select Align Printer . This prints an alignment test page. You'll be prompted to scan the page now.

steps.title: Lift the scanner lid.
steps.content: Lift the scanner lid. You'll be realigning the cartridges by scanning the alignment page.

steps.title: Place the alignment test page on the scanner.
steps.content: Place the alignment test page on the scanner. The printed side should be face-down.

steps.title: Line up the alignment sheet with the front right corner of the scanner glass.
steps.content: Line up the alignment sheet with the front right corner of the scanner glass.

steps.title: Close the scanner lid and press OK.
steps.content: Close the scanner lid and press OK . Your printer will scan the alignment page and then realign the cartridges as needed. If you see get an error that says "Alignment Failed" or "Alignment Unsuccessful," see the Fixing Alignment Issues method.

steps.title: Make sure you're using clean white paper to align the printer.
steps.content: Make sure you're using clean white paper to align the printer. If you're unable to properly align the printer using the method for your operating system, make sure your printer paper is unused, unwrinkled, and properly inserted.

steps.title: Scan the alignment page if required.
steps.content: Scan the alignment page if required. If you have a combination printer/scanner, you'll have to scan the printed alignment page to realign the cartridges. Follow the on-screen instructions, as well as any instructions that appear on the alignment page, to make sure you're completing the whole process.

steps.title: Reset the printer.
steps.content: Reset the printer. If you're still experiencing issues, unplug the power cable from the printer for 60 seconds, and then plug it back in. Try aligning the cartridges again when the printer comes back up.

steps.title: Make sure you're using genuine HP ink cartridges.
steps.content: Make sure you're using genuine HP ink cartridges. If you're not using genuine HP ink or toner cartridges, replace your cartridges with new ones from HP. Counterfeit cartridges could cause alignment issues. Visit https://www.hp.com/us-en/cartridge/anti-counterfeit.html to learn more about counterfeit cartridges.

steps.title: Evaluate the printed alignment page for ink issues.
steps.content: Evaluate the printed alignment page for ink issues. A proper alignment page should show strong blue and black lines. If your printer is low on ink, the alignment page may appear faded, streaky, or smeared. Black and/or cyan may not show up on the page. If any of these things are happening, you're likely low on ink and need to replace the cartridges. If the printed alignment page does not have any streaks and you see both black and blue on the page, contact HP support to service the printer.
